panama.tools
Class TileTool

java.lang.Object
  panama.tools.TileTool

@DefaultKey(value="tiles")
@InvalidScope(value={"application","session"})
public class TileTool
extends java.lang.Object

Support for Tiles. Must be placed in Request-Scope!

Author:
Ridcully

Method Detail

embed

public void embed(java.lang.String controllerName,
                  java.lang.String actionName)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Executes specified action and renders the resulting template. This method executes the given action. If the action returns a TemplateTarget, it's go() method is invoked. So this method can easily be used to create tiles, blocks and the like. For example if you have a ShoppingCart Controller with a view action returning a template rendering your cart, you may execute that action from within every template you like and #include the result to include the cart-template within your template.

Parameters:
controllerName - The name of the controller to use.
actionName - The name of the action to execute.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
Dispatcher#handleAction(Context, String)

embed

public void embed(java.lang.String controllerName,
                  java.lang.String actionName,
                  java.util.Map parameterMap)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Executes specified action and returns parsed resulting template. This method allows to add additional parameters to ctx or to overwrite existing ones. Note, that the additional parameters only exist during the execution of the action. After that, the original parameters are restored.

Parameters:
controllerName - The name of the controller to use.
actionName - The name of the action to execute.
parameterMap - A map of additional parameters; all keys an values should be strings or will converted using toString().
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
#executeAction(String controllerName, String actionName)
